lines.text: [Last lines]

[to one of the stone gargoyles]
Why was I not made of stone - like thee?

I never realized till now how ugly I am, because you're so beautiful... I'm not a man! I'm not a beast! I'm about as shapeless as the man in the moon! I'm deaf, you know, but you can speak to me by signs.
Why did you save me?
You ask me why I saved you? Oh, I tried to carry you off, and the next day you gave me a drink of water and little pity.
Sanctuary! Sanctuary!
Our whipper could make him cry.
Are you saying you have a better whipper in Marseilles than we have in Paris?
Yes!
[they knock him off the steps]
She gave me water.

[holding Esmeralda over his head, to the crowd]
Sanctuary! Sanctuary!
Ohh, you asked me why I saved you. I tried to carry you off, and the next day, you gave me a drink of water, and a little pity.

[half-laughing, half-weeping]
I'm about as shapeless as the man in the moon!
Try to take a purse out of that pocket, but if one single bell jingles, you fail.
And then?
And then you hang!

[pondering for a moment]
Can you do it?
I'm above that sort of thing. I cut throats. I don't cut purses.

[to Gringoire immediately following flogging of Quasimodo]
Never trust a man with pinched nostrils and thin lips.
[Watching Esmeralda dance]
Doesn't she make your pulse beat faster?
I'm a widower four times, sire, but I could begin all over again.
Doctor, lend me half a livre.
Half a livre?
Afraid I won't repay you?
Your hands are like ice. You're not afraid are you?
Not now oh Gringoire, Why did I ever come to Paris?
Don't cry darling
I keep thinking and thinking How I came here to soften the king heart towards my people until my silly heart betrayed me for that I deserve to die.
You will not! I will get you free
You will look out after my people when I am gone
The press should be destroyed and the printer hanged for blasphemy.
